WorkItem.Description:
Shouldn't ///<reference  path="x.ts"/> be transformed to 
///<reference  path="x.js"/>?

Now the compiler puts a reference to a ts file instead of a js file in the output.

Is this intentional because it confuses other tools that use the js files.

Comments.Message:
Why would other tools be bothered about comments mentioning identifiobject property xxx.ts? How that tool decides it's a file and not object.property notation.

If you compiled all your TS files into one JS, that reference wouldn't even if as JS â€“ now that would confuse tools.

P.S. Man, this editor is annoying in a mobile browser.

i run tests using the QUnit integration feature of resharper. Resharper is able to parse the reference path directives and create a test page that references all js that are required.
It is of course not able to identify the references from the typescript generated js files

I modified my fork of the compiler to do this modification.
Interesting is that reference paths go to AST nodes of type Comment. I would expect that they would create special nodes. It seems that the references are checked in a precompilation phase.

Anyway it is very easy to modify the compiler.
